Author: NNoperator#3835
Content:
I've noticed some testnet splitting transactions that are producing as few as 2 UTXOs, that is really taking it to crazy extremes.   If your node happens to notarize that transaction, you consume half of your splits, not to mention the other 6 (or 12 UTXOs for mainnet) that also go into the notarization.   
 https://beer.kmdexplorer.io/tx/c18452e6ffd5754ed9a9a0e047505f5655d8eca18155975bd2af3c54b552afdf

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: maybe it is OK for BEER as it is crazy active, and there will be tons of other transactions going along with the ride.  But if you roll that way with other less active coins, it isn't going to be sustainable.  So make sure you at least get a case of BEER if you are going to do a BEER run!üçª

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: We are still doubly notarizing BEER !  Drunk nodes on the sloshy network.

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: https://beer.kmdexplorer.io/block/00238a7d699b60a792d0fcce0402ee4e8ece173e3eec0a28a96aa703b0fdb20f

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: Here is an example notarization, where one operator consumed 1/2 of his split, and another operator consumed 1/3 of his split.  It may be helpful notarizing your own splits to stay at the top of the testnet stats, but it isn't behavior that is sustainable or good for the network.  https://beer.kmdexplorer.io/block/003077717db0765d6a841be37c969be022dfa6e54b6ab7c4d12e60fd00e56bb8
